title.narrative: ACCESS WITH QUALITY TO HIGHER EDUCATION PROJECT-ACCES II -SOP PHASE 2

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to increase student enrollment, graduation and equity in higher education, by: (a) increasing the number of ACCES Student Loans and the ACCES Program’s focus on students from disadvantaged socioeconomic backgrounds and in quality higher education institutions and programs; and (b) enhancing ICETEX’s institutional capacity.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Anti-Corruption (Section I.B.2 of Schedule 2) | Description :By exercising its rights under HEI Contracts(Cláusula 9), Borrower shall enable Bank: (a) to inspect accounts, records & other documents of Eligible HEIs relating to Projectupon Bank’s request to Borrower; and (b) to have such accounts, records & other documents audited by or on behalf of the Bank,using the the Terms of Reference agreed with the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation - General (Section I.A.3 of Schedule 2: ) | Description :The Borrower shall maintain,throughout the implementation of the Project, key staff for the Project, including, without limitation, a Project coordinator, allwith terms of reference, and qualifications and experience satisfactory tothe Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation – General (cont.) (Section I.A.3 of Schedule 2: ) | Description :Not later than May 15,2014, the Borrower shall approve the new methodology described in the Operational Manual, for the allocationACCES Programresources. | Due Date :15-May-2014
Finance Agreement :Safeguards (Section I.D of Schedule 2) | Description :The Borrower shall carry out the Project in accordancewith the IPP. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Student Loans (Section I.C.1 of Schedule 2) | Description :Prior to the provision of any ACCES Student Loan, theBorrower shall enter into an agreement (“StudentLoan Agreement”) with the corresponding Eligible Student, under terms andconditions acceptable to the Bank, including, inter alia,the obligation of the EligibleStudent to repay the ACCES Student Loan. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Student Loans (cont.) (Section I.C.2 of Schedule 2) | Description :Prior to transfer of proceeds of the Loan toany given Eligible HEI, Borrower shall enter into a HEI Contract with Eligible HEI, under terms and conditions acceptable to Bank.|Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Increase student enrollment in higher education- 1. Enrollment in higher education.

3. Percentage of new ACCES student loans given to students who qualify for a government subsistence grant.

1. Number of new students obtaining an ACCES student Loan.
Increase equity in higher education- 4. Percentage of graduates from families earning less than 2 minimum salaries.
12. Subcomponent 2.2--Percentage of HEIs that perform above the benchmark on at least 5 of the 6 indicators in the scorecards.
Increase equity in higher education- 3. Percentage of new students enrolled in higher education from families earning less than 2 minimum salaries.
13. Subcomponent 2.2--Sustainability index - Student loan attrition (non-renewal) and associated default rate among ACCES recipients.
14 a) Subcomponent 2.3--Total sum of resources available for student credit generated from external sources (Funds under Administration).
5. Percentage of new ACCES student loans given to indigenous peoples, afro-Colombians, Roma and victims of violence.
14 b) Subcomponent 2.3 --Total sum of resources available for student credit generated from external sources (ICETEX budget).
